<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bitsetinfo">BitSetInfo</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bitsetbuilder/#aa21d510ab0919fcc10fbbb02ead13dab">build</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class implements a layout algorithm for globals referenced by bit sets</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// that tries to keep members of small bit sets together. This can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// significantly reduce bit set sizes in many cases.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It works by assembling fragments of layout from sets of referenced globals.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Each set of referenced globals causes the algorithm to create a new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fragment, which is assembled by appending each referenced global in the set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// into the fragment. If a referenced global has already been referenced by an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fragment created earlier, we instead delete that fragment and append its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">/// contents into the fragment we are assembling.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// By starting with the smallest fragments, we minimize the size of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fragments that are copied into larger fragments. This is most intuitively</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// thought about when considering the case where the globals are virtual tables</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and the bit sets represent their derived classes: in a single inheritance</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// hierarchy, the optimum layout would involve a depth-first search of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// class hierarchy (and in fact the computed layout ends up looking a lot like</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a DFS), but a naive DFS would not work well in the presence of multiple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// inheritance. This aspect of the algorithm ends up fitting smaller</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">/// hierarchies inside larger ones where that would be beneficial.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example, consider this class hierarchy:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A       B</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">///   \\   / | \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">///     C   D   E</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We have five bit sets: bsA (A, C), bsB (B, C, D, E), bsC (C), bsD (D) and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bsE (E). If we laid out our objects by DFS traversing B followed by A, our</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// layout would be &#123;B, C, D, E, A&#125;. This is optimal for bsB as it needs to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cover the only 4 objects in its hierarchy, but not for bsA as it needs to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cover 5 objects, i.e. the entire layout. Our algorithm proceeds as follows:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Add bsC, fragments &#123;&#123;C&#125;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Add bsD, fragments &#123;&#123;C&#125;, &#123;D&#125;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Add bsE, fragments &#123;&#123;C&#125;, &#123;D&#125;, &#123;E&#125;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Add bsA, fragments &#123;&#123;A, C&#125;, &#123;D&#125;, &#123;E&#125;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Add bsB, fragments &#123;&#123;B, A, C, D, E&#125;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This layout is optimal for bsA, as it now only needs to cover two (i.e. 3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fewer) objects, at the cost of bsB needing to cover 1 more object.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The bit set lowering pass assigns an object index to each object that needs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to be laid out, and calls addFragment for each bit set passing the object</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">/// indices of its referenced globals. It then assembles a layout from the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// computed layout in the Fragments field.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a2354a7882002ba4c12cd5f3be8dba7dd">GlobalLayoutBuilder</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The computed layout. Each element of this vector contains a fragment of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// layout (which may be empty) consisting of object indices.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a5d2e54b342691d69ccfc9e799d404668"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;std::vector&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a5d2e54b342691d69ccfc9e799d404668">Fragments</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Mapping from object index to fragment index.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#ad3e6889c1625ade2687b7fee501f64be"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#ad3e6889c1625ade2687b7fee501f64be">FragmentMap</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a2354a7882002ba4c12cd5f3be8dba7dd"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a2354a7882002ba4c12cd5f3be8dba7dd">GlobalLayoutBuilder</a>(uint64&#95;t NumObjects)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">      : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a5d2e54b342691d69ccfc9e799d404668">Fragments</a>(1), <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#ad3e6889c1625ade2687b7fee501f64be">FragmentMap</a>(NumObjects) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add F to the layout while trying to keep its indices contiguous.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If a previously seen fragment uses any of F&#39;s indices, that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// fragment will be laid out inside F.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#abc53ed9289ca61898a56ea65b8a457db">addFragment</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::set&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class is used to build a byte array containing overlapping bit sets. By</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loading from indexed offsets into the byte array and applying a mask, a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">/// program can test bits from the bit set with a relatively short instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">/// sequence. For example, suppose we have 15 bit sets to lay out:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A (16 bits), B (15 bits), C (14 bits), D (13 bits), E (12 bits),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">/// F (11 bits), G (10 bits), H (9 bits), I (7 bits), J (6 bits), K (5 bits),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">/// L (4 bits), M (3 bits), N (2 bits), O (1 bit)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">/// These bits can be laid out in a 16-byte array like this:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">///       Byte Offset</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">///     0123456789ABCDEF</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">///   7 HHHHHHHHHIIIIIII</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">///   6 GGGGGGGGGGJJJJJJ</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">///   5 FFFFFFFFFFFKKKKK</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">///   4 EEEEEEEEEEEELLLL</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">///   3 DDDDDDDDDDDDDMMM</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">///   2 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCNN</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">///   1 BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBO</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">///   0 AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example, to test bit X of A, we evaluate ((bits&#91;X&#93; &amp; 1) != 0), or to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">/// test bit X of I, we evaluate ((bits&#91;9 + X&#93; &amp; 0x80) != 0). This can be done</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in 1-2 machine instructions on x86, or 4-6 instructions on ARM.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a byte array, rather than (say) a 2-byte array or a 4-byte array,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="comment">/// because for one thing it gives us better packing (the more bins there are,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the less evenly they will be filled), and for another, the instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="comment">/// sequences can be slightly shorter, both on x86 and ARM.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a7e7d04e07fc7f640097f08663ec3ccee">ByteArrayBuilder</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The byte array built so far.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#ab9bf25f047271def1203635a5725eeff"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#ab9bf25f047271def1203635a5725eeff">Bytes</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a456d9afc9af28332a92e0a67cbbc7098a961b1f972e23c16ecc4ddffe1ddfbdca"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a456d9afc9af28332a92e0a67cbbc7098a961b1f972e23c16ecc4ddffe1ddfbdca">BitsPerByte</a> = 8 &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The number of bytes allocated so far for each of the bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643">BitAllocs</a>&#91;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a456d9afc9af28332a92e0a67cbbc7098a961b1f972e23c16ecc4ddffe1ddfbdca">BitsPerByte</a>&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a7e7d04e07fc7f640097f08663ec3ccee"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a7e7d04e07fc7f640097f08663ec3ccee">ByteArrayBuilder</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal">    memset(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643">BitAllocs</a>, 0, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643">BitAllocs</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Allocate BitSize bits in the byte array where Bits contains the bits to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// set. AllocByteOffset is set to the offset within the byte array and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// AllocMask is set to the bitmask for those bits. This uses the LPT (Longest</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Processing Time) multiprocessor scheduling algorithm to lay out the bits</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// efficiently; the pass allocates bit sets in decreasing size order.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#aefcc42b423b9473d155867e579682a9e">allocate</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::set&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; &amp;Bits, uint64&#95;t BitSize,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal">                uint64&#95;t &amp;AllocByteOffset, uint8&#95;t &amp;AllocMask);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#ab6535371eaec8620c84bbb0689535dbb">isJumpTableCanonical</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Specifies how to drop type tests.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83ada"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83ada">DropTestKind</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754">None</a>,   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/// Do not drop type tests (default).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa4822c96fc1eebe031cde975d10a29e12"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa4822c96fc1eebe031cde975d10a29e12">Assume</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/// Drop only llvm.assumes using type test value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaab1c94ca2fbc3e78fc30069c8d0f01680"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaab1c94ca2fbc3e78fc30069c8d0f01680">All</a>,    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/// Drop the type test and all uses.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// end namespace lowertypetests</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lowertypetestspass"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lowertypetestspass/#a0da2382d9008c7a7b6f9c77f7282a0a0">LowerTypeTestsPass</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/passinfomixin">PassInfoMixin</a>&lt;LowerTypeTestsPass&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
